intro: Richella grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered richella, is a herbaceous perennial native to the temperate regions of South America. It features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture and produces striking, showy flowers in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and compact growth habit.
